com.facebook.buck.core.starlark.rule.attr

Class Attribute<CoercedType>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.buck.core.starlark.rule.attr.Attribute<CoercedType>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AttributeHolder, com.google.devtools.build.lib.skylarkinterface.SkylarkPrintable, com.google.devtools.build.lib.skylarkinterface.SkylarkValue
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BoolAttribute, DepAttribute, DepListAttribute, IntAttribute, IntListAttribute, OutputAttribute, OutputListAttribute, SourceAttribute, SourceListAttribute, SourceSortedSetAttribute, StringAttribute, StringListAttribute, StringSortedSetAttribute, UnconfiguredDepListAttribute, UnconfiguredOptionalDepAttribute

    public abstract class Attribute<CoercedType>
extends Object
implements AttributeHolder
    Representation of a parameter of a user defined rule

public Type getGenericType()

      • getPreCoercionDefaultValue

        public abstract Object getPreCoercionDefaultValue()
        The default value to use if no value is provided.

        This will be validated against getTypeCoercer(), so may return a value whose type does not match CoercedType (e.g. a list of strings, rather than a list of SourcePath)

      • getDoc

        public abstract String getDoc()
        The docstring to use for this attribute

        public abstract boolean getMandatory()
        Whether this attribute is mandatory or not

      • getTypeCoercer

        public abstract TypeCoercer<?,CoercedType> getTypeCoercer()
        The type coercer to use to convert raw values from the parser into something usable internally. This coercer also performs validation

      • validateCoercedValue

        protected void validateCoercedValue(CoercedType value)
                             throws CoerceFailedException
        Validates values post-coercion to ensure other properties besides 'type' are valid
        Parameters:
        value - The value to check
        Throws:
        CoerceFailedException - if the value is invalid (e.g. not in a list of pre-approved values)

      • getPostCoercionTransform

        public PostCoercionTransform<RuleAnalysisContext,?> getPostCoercionTransform()
        Returns:
        a method that transforms a coerced value into something more useful to users, taking into account the rule's dependencies

      • getValue

        public CoercedType getValue(CellNameResolver cellNameResolver,
                            ProjectFilesystem projectFilesystem,
                            ForwardRelativePath pathRelativeToProjectRoot,
                            TargetConfiguration targetConfiguration,
                            TargetConfiguration hostConfiguration,
                            Object value)
                     throws CoerceFailedException
        Get the coerced value for this attribute.
        Parameters:
        cellNameResolver - The cell roots
        projectFilesystem - The project file system
        pathRelativeToProjectRoot - The path relative to the project root
        targetConfiguration - The configuration for this target
        hostConfiguration -
        value - The object that is to be coerced. This generally comes directly from the parser.
        Throws:
        CoerceFailedException - if the value could not be coerced

      • validateValueInList

        protected void validateValueInList(List<CoercedType> values,
                                   CoercedType value)
                            throws CoerceFailedException
        Helper method to validate that a value is in a list and throw a reasonable error if not
        Throws:
        CoerceFailedException

      • validateProvidersPresent

        protected static void validateProvidersPresent(List<Provider<?>> expectedProviders,
                                               BuildTarget target,
                                               ProviderInfoCollection providerInfos)
        Ensures that all of the Providers in expectedProviders are present in providerInfos

        Note that it is enforced that all build rules return at least DefaultInfo, so that is not required to be specified

        Parameters:
        expectedProviders - The providers that ALL MUST be present. If empty, no providers are required, and all providerInfos will be considered valid.
        target - the target that providerInfos is associated with. Used in errors.
        providerInfos - The ProviderInfos for a given dependency
        Throws:
        com.google.common.base.VerifyException - if a provider is missing in providerInfos
